title: The Bachelorette's Angie Kent slams Married At First Sight and labels it 'SUPER-TRASH'
text:
She's the Bachelorette star who first became famous on Gogglebox before doing a stint on I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!

And this weekend Angie Kent spoke about reality TV as a genre, while slamming Nine's Married At First Sight as being 'trash'.

Speaking to The Sun-Herald, the 29-year-old didn't hold back when she compared Australian TV shows to their British and American counterparts.

'We do push the boundaries of reality TV': The Bachelorette's Angie Kent (pictured) slammed Married At First Sight this weekend, labeling the program as 'trash'

'Over there, it's trash,' Angie began, before taking a swipe at MAFS.

'The only super-trash we have here is MAFS.'

She added about reality TV Down Under: 'We do push, but we don't push too far.'

Ouch! 'The only super-trash we have here is MAFS,' Angie said when comparing Australian reality shows to American and British counterparts. Pictured are MAFS stars Jessika Power and Tamara Joy

The blonde said she thinks other Australian reality TV shows are 'pretty healthy' and said she loves the genre.

Angie is set to make her debut as The Bachelorette on Wednesday on Ten.

In March, she confirmed her new role as The Bachelorette, saying she's finally ready for love.

Looking for love: Angie is set to make her debut as The Bachelorette this Wednesday on Ten

'I've always been the gal who loves to make everyone laugh, but now I reckon it's time to have someone laugh with me, rather than at me,' she said on Instagram at the time.

Angie meanwhile revealed earlier this week that she found the man of her dreams on the show and is still in a relationship with him.

Speaking to OK! magazine, she admitted she's 'very, very happy.'

'I'm totally glad I did it. I've learnt so much about myself,' she said.

The Bachelorette starts on Wednesday on Channel Ten.
description: She's the Bachelorette star who first became famous on Gogglebox before doing a stint on I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
